column1: Wildwood is a city in Cape May County

column1: Wildwood was originally incorporated as a borough by an act of the New Jersey Legislature on May 1
column3: from portions of Middle Township
column4: based on the results of a referendum held the previous day. On January 1
column6: Wildwood was incorporated as a city
column7: replacing both Wildwood borough and Holly Beach City.The Wildwoods began developing as a resort in the last decade of the 19th century. A building boom began in the 1950s
column8: due partially to the construction and completion of the Garden State Parkway in 1955."Rock Around the Clock"
column9: often credited as the first rock and roll record
column10: was first performed on Memorial Day weekend in 1954 at the HofBrau Hotel in Wildwood by Bill Haley & His Comets. The song's status as one of the first rock and roll hits has given rise to the city's claim as "the birthplace of rock and roll". Chubby Checker introduced his version of The Twist (song) at the Rainbow Club. On occasion
column11: American Bandstand broadcast from the Wildwood's Starlight Ballroom. Murals in the community honor Checker
column12: Bill Haley and Bobby Rydell; the latter artist had a major hit with Wildwood Days in 1963

column1: Wildwood is home to over 200 motels
column2: built during the Doo-Wop era of the 1950s and 1960s
column3: in an area recognized by the state of New Jersey
column4: known as the Wildwoods Shore Resort Historic District. The term "doo-wop" was coined by Cape May's Mid-Atlantic Center For The Arts in the early 1990s to describe the unique
column5: space-age architectural style
column6: which is also referred to as the Googie or populuxe style.The motels are unique in appearance
column7: with Vegas-like neon signs and fantastic architecture. New construction in the area has seen the demolition of several motels to make room for larger condominiums. The Wildwood Doo Wop Preservation League has taken action to help save and restore these historic buildings. The Caribbean Motel in Wildwood Crest
column8: and the Chateau Bleu Motel in North Wildwood are both listed on the National Register of Historic Places.A 1950s Doo Wop museum includes property from demolished motels such as neon signs and furniture. Neo-Doo Wop buildings in the area feature a neon lit Wawa and a 1950s styled Acme Supermarket.

column1: Portions of the city—together with areas in North Wildwood
column2: West Wildwood and Wildwood Crest—are part of a joint Urban Enterprise Zone (UEZ)
column3: one of 32 zones covering 37 municipalities statewide. The four municipalities in The Wildwoods were selected in 2002 as one of a group of three zones added to participate in the program as part of a joint zone with. In addition to other benefits to encourage employment and investment within the Zone
column4: shoppers can take advantage of a reduced 3.3125% sales tax rate (half of the ​6 5⁄8% rate charged statewide) at eligible merchants. Established in September 2002
column5: the city's Urban Enterprise Zone status expires in December 2023. The joint UEZ is overseen by the Enterprise Zone Development Corporation of the Wildwoods Board
column6: which includes representatives from all four municipalities.Wildwood has an unusually large number of liquor licenses for its population. State law normally provides for one consumption license (i.e.
column11: for a liquor store) for every 7
column12: 500 residents. Because of a state law allowing a municipality to grandfather in liquor licenses that existed before 1948

column1: Wildwood is a resort city that is very popular with vacationers and tourists mostly from New Jersey
column2: Delaware
column3: Maryland
column4: Pennsylvania
column5: New York
column6: and even nearby parts of Canada (particularly Ontario and Quebec) during the summer months. The year-round population of Wildwood of over 5
column8: 000 or more during the peak tourist season during the summer. Its most notable features are its beach and 1.8 miles (2.9 km) boardwalk
column9: home to the Morey's Piers amusement complex and Raging Waters and Ocean Oasis waterparks owned by Morey's Piers. The boardwalk features a trolley called the "Tramcar"
column10: which runs from end to end. In June 2006
column11: its Doo-Wop-style motels were placed on the National Trust for Historic Preservation's annual Eleven Most Endangered List
column12: described as "irreplaceable icons of popular culture." In June
column13: thousands of recently graduated high school seniors come to Wildwood for Senior Week. During Senior Week
column14: the graduates stay in hotels and rent beach houses in Wildwood where they party and participate in underage drinking.

column1: Wildwood was ranked the best beach in New Jersey in the 2008 Top 10 Beaches Contest sponsored by the New Jersey Marine Sciences Consortium. Wildwood is one of five municipalities in the state that offer free public access to oceanfront beaches monitored by lifeguards
column2: joining Atlantic City
column3: North Wildwood
column4: Wildwood Crest and Upper Township's Strathmere section.Wildwood is home to the New Jersey Firefighter's Convention
column5: held annually every September since the 1970s. Known for its parade featuring fire company apparatus from across the state
column6: it moved from Atlantic City due in part to rising crime and the disallowing of the parade on city streets. Wildwood is also home to an annual co-ed beach Ultimate Frisbee tournament drawing teams from all over the country that attracted 430 teams and over 5
column7: 000 players to its 19th annual event in 2011.French Canadian tourists from Quebec visit Wildwood during the summer. There are hotels in the Wildwoods named to lure tourists from Quebec
column12: and Quebec. Several hotels in Wildwood have signs in both English and French. The French Canadian tourists primarily vacation in Wildwood in July when Canada takes a two-week construction holiday.

column1: The Wildwood Boardwalk features several amusement parks and shops
column2: most notably three piers collectively known as Morey's Piers. Due to the distance of the ocean from the boardwalk
column3: the beach is home to many sporting events
column4: concerts
column5: and monster truck rallies in view of the boardwalk. Wildwood is the tenth most popular boardwalk in the United States. A stage is set off to the side of the boardwalk near Mariner's Landing Pier where several performances are held throughout the summer.

column2: a section of the boardwalk was rebuilt using ipe tropical hardwood
column3: even though the town had made a commitment to use domestic black locust as a more environmentally friendly option. The black locust wood shipped by the supplier was deemed unacceptable and the commissioners decided to use ipe wood to ensure that the project could be completed in time for the upcoming season.Boardwalk Chapel is a summertime Christian Gospel outreach on the boardwalk
column4: sandwiched between a pizzeria and a gift shop. Visitors to the boardwalk are invited to attend any of its 77 consecutive evening services held during June
column5: July and August.

column1: Wildwood is governed by a three-member commission under the Walsh Act Commission form of municipal government. The city is one of 30 municipalities (of the 565) statewide that use this form of government. The governing body is comprised of three commissioners
column2: who are elected at-large on a nonpartisan basis to serve concurrent four-year terms of office
column3: with the vote taking place as part of the November general election. At a reorganization conducted after each election
column4: the commission selects one of its members to serve as mayor and gives each commissioner an assigned department to oversee and manage. As part of the May 2009 election
column5: voters approved a ballot question that shifted elections from May to November. The first election under the new cycle was held in November 2013
column7: 000 each election cited as the primary justification for the change.As of 2020

column3: 2023.The Wildwood Housing Authority oversees public housing in the city of Wildwood
column4: providing affordable housing to low and moderate income families
column5: senior citizens
column6: and disabled people. The agency is governed by a seven-member board of commissioners
column7: with six appointed by the Mayor and one appointed by the Department of Community Affairs. The housing authority owns two housing developments with a total of 170 units between them. Sandman Tower offers 100 one-bedroom apartments while Commissioners Court offers 70 apartments.

column1: Since the City of Wildwood has been incorporated on January 1
column3: there have been three recall elections all of which were successful. The first was in 1938 when the State's first female Mayor Doris W. Bradway and Commissioner Frederick W. Murray were voted out of office. The second successful recall was in December 1984 when Mayor Earl B. Ostrander was recalled. The third successful recall was in December 2009 when Mayor Ernest Troiano Jr. and Commissioner William N. Davenport were recalled.

column1: The Wildwood Public School District serves students in pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade. As of the 2017–18 school year
column2: the district
column3: comprised of three schools
column4: had a total enrollment of 909 students and 96.4 classroom teachers (on an FTE basis)
column5: for a student–teacher ratio of 9.4:1. Schools in the district (with 2017-18 enrollment data from the National Center for Education Statistics) are

column1: Wildwood High School (9-12; 234 students). For ninth through twelfth grades
column2: students from North Wildwood and Wildwood Crest attend Wildwood High School as part of sending/receiving relationships. Public school students from West Wildwood
column3: a non-operating school district
column4: attend the district's schools for grades K-12 as part of a sending/receiving relationship.Students are also eligible to attend Cape May County Technical High School in Cape May Court House
column5: which serves students from the entire county in its comprehensive and vocational programs
column6: which are offered without charge to students who are county residents.There is one Catholic school on the island
column7: Wildwood Catholic Academy (PreK-12) in North Wildwood
column8: which operates under the auspices of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Camden. There was previously a Catholic elementary school in Wildwood
column11: when it merged into Cape Trinity Regional School (PreK – 8) in North Wildwood. Upon its creation Cape Trinity Catholic Regional School operated separately from Wildwood Catholic High School but shared a common building. On April 17
column13: the Diocese of Camden announced that both of its Wildwood schools would permanently close at the end of the school year
column16: both schools avoided closure after agreeing to merge.

column1: The city had a total of 32.38 miles (52.11 km) of roadways
column2: of which 29.93 miles (48.17 km) were maintained by the municipality
column3: 2.37 miles (3.81 km) by Cape May County and 0.08 miles (0.13 km) by the New Jersey Department of Transportation.Route 47 (Rio Grande Avenue) has its southern terminus in Wildwood and continues into Lower Township via the George Reading Wildwood Bridge
column4: which provides access to the Garden State Parkway. County Route 621 (New Jersey Avenue) runs for 1.3 miles (2.1 km) through the city
column5: from Wildwood Crest to the south to North Wildwood in the north
column6: and serves as part of Ocean Drive.Parking in the beach and downtown areas of Wildwood is regulated by on-street parking meters and paid parking lots. Parking meters in Wildwood are in effect from May 15 to October 31. Wildwood has 24 paid parking lots in the beach area that are privately owned and charge varying rates based on demand. Among these lots is a 719-space lot operated by the Wildwoods Convention Center. There is also a public parking lot along Schellenger Avenue in the downtown area. In 2018
column7: Wildwood began offering paid parking on the beach for vehicles with four-wheel drive at Baker Avenue

column1: NJ Transit provides bus service to Philadelphia on the 313 and 315 routes and to Atlantic City on the 552 route
column2: with seasonal service to Philadelphia on the 316 route
column3: to the Port Authority Bus Terminal in Midtown Manhattan on the 319 route
column4: and to Rio Grande on the 510 route. NJ Transit buses stop at the Wildwood Bus Terminal
column5: which is located on Washington Avenue between Burk Avenue and Davis Avenue.The Great American Trolley Company operates trolley service in Wildwood during the summer months. There are two trolley routes that provide service to the boardwalk at Schellenger Avenue in Wildwood during the evening hours
column6: with one route serving Wildwood and Wildwood Crest daily and the other route serving North Wildwood on Fridays and Saturdays. Another trolley route runs from North Wildwood and Wildwood to shopping centers in Rio Grande
column7: operating Mondays through Fridays. The Great American Trolley Company also runs trolley service to the Irish Fall Festival in North Wildwood
column8: with a route connecting Wildwood Crest and Wildwood to the festival site during the weekend of the festival.The Tramcar is a trackless train service running along the entire length of the Wildwoods boardwalk from Cresse Avenue in Wildwood to 16th Avenue in North Wildwood during the summer season.

column1: WMGM-TV virtual channel 40 (UHF channel 36) is a Justice Network affiliated TV station and is the first and only TV station licensed to Wildwood. Their offices and studios are located in Linwood in neighboring Atlantic County.
WCMC (AM) is a radio station licensed to Wildwood and broadcasts on 1230 AM with an Oldies format which it simulcasts from sister station WMID.
WZXL is a radio station licensed to Wildwood and broadcasts on 100.7 FM with a Classic rock format.
Residents of Wildwood are served by Comcast Cable's Xfinity service.
The City of Wildwood is served by local and distance newspapers with local editions. They are:
The Press of Atlantic City a major daily newspaper in South New Jersey which includes a Cape May County edition.
Cape May County Herald a weekly newspaper with news and information for residents of Cape May County.
The Star-Ledger a major daily newspaper based in Newark which prints a local edition for Cape May County.
Philadelphia Daily News a major daily newspaper based in Philadelphia with local editions for Cape May County.
The Philadelphia Inquirer a major daily newspaper based in Philadelphia with local editions for Cape May County.
According to the Köppen climate classification system
column2: Wildwood
column3: New Jersey has a humid subtropical climate (Cfa) with hot
column4: moderately humid summers
column5: cool winters and year-around precipitation. Cfa climates are characterized by all months having an average mean temperature > 32.0 °F (> 0.0 °C)
column6: at least four months with an average mean temperature ≥ 50.0 °F (≥ 10.0 °C)
column7: at least one month with an average mean temperature ≥ 71.6 °F (≥ 22.0 °C) and no significant precipitation difference between seasons. During the summer months in Wildwood
column8: a cooling afternoon sea breeze is present on most days
column9: but episodes of extreme heat and humidity can occur with heat index values ≥ 95 °F (≥ 35 °C). During the winter months
column10: episodes of extreme cold and wind can occur with wind chill values < 0 °F (< -18 °C). The plant hardiness zone at Wildwood Beach is 7b with an average annual extreme minimum air temperature of 6.7 °F (-14.1 °C). The average seasonal (Nov-Apr) snowfall total is between 12 and 18 inches (31 and 46 cm)
column11: and the average snowiest month is February which corresponds with the annual peak in nor'easter activity.

column3: New Jersey would have a dominant vegetation type of Northern Cordgrass (73) with a dominant vegetation form of Coastal Prairie (20).
